name: DevOps Team Lead (to Yerevan)
description:
BostonGene is a pioneer company that uses self-developed biomedical software to identify personalized treatment options with next-generation multi-platform analytics, improving and optimizing cancer patient outcomes. We develop a distributed information and analytical system that provides oncologists with the necessary data for diagnosis and personalized treatment of patients.

We moved our Moscow office (400+ employees) to Yerevan and are looking for candidates to work from Armenia, we offer a complete relocation package for candidates from other countries.

We are seeking an experienced and motivated DevOps Team Lead to join our Platform Engineering team.

As the Team Lead, you will be responsible for leading our team of DevOps Engineers (5 platform engineers) and ensuring the reliability, scalability, and performance of our infrastructure and applications.

Responsibilities:

— Lead and manage a team of DevOps Engineers, providing guidance, support, and mentorship to ensure the team's success.

— Define and implement best practices for processes and tools to improve system reliability, scalability, and performance.

— Collaborate with development teams and Head of Development to understand system requirements, identify potential issues, and design solutions to enhance system stability and resiliency.

— Drive the implementation of effective monitoring, alerting, and incident response processes to proactively identify and resolve system issues.

— Lead incident management and post-incident analysis activities to identify root causes and implement preventive measures.

Requirements:

— Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field;

— Proven experience as a DevOps / SRE / IT Ops Lead or in a similar role, with a strong background in systems administration and incident management;

— Experience managing a team of up to 5 people;

— Experience with Terraform, Ansible;

— Experience working with monitoring and observability tools like Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack;

— Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex systems and troubleshoot issues;

— Basic knowledge of k8s;

— English language skills B2.

Nice to have:

— Experience with cloud platforms such (we use AWS);

— Knowledge of containerization technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes;

We offer:

— relocation for candidates (and their immediate family members, and dogs\cats) to Armenia;

— full documentation and bureaucracy support on-site (bank accounts, residence permit, school contacts, etc);

— full-time position, permanent contract, flexible working hours, remote work;

— comfortable new office in the infrastructure center of Yerevan if you wish to work from the office, on-site snacks;

— competitive salary and regular performance review;

— medical insurance, corporate plans for English language lessons, Armenian language lessons, and gym.
